info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 31 at 3:39PM EDT until July 31 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Baltimore MD/Washington DC
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of northern Maryland, including the following counties, Baltimore and Harford.
* WHEN...Until 430 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 339 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring, with some roads in the Joppatowne area closed due to flooding, including U.S. 40. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bel Air South... Carney... Perry Hall... White Marsh... Kingsville... Edgewood... Joppatowne... Bradshaw... Gunpowder... Joppa... Upper Falls... Magnolia... - This includes the following Flood Prone Roads... Philadelphia Road at Gunpowder Falls and Route 7 at Hall Street. - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING
